column4: i got a laptop, and i got a 19 inches display, how can i tell Ubuntu to use the two screen the same time ?
i mean, i can got two screen showing different infomation!
what video card?
GMA 4500
you want them to show the same thing or not?
not the same thing,  i want one to show , for example, firefox, the other show the x-terminal or play movies
have you looked in Screen Resolution and made sure Mirror Screens isn't enabled?
what ? my resolution is 1280 800, and in the Screen Resolution, i have not see "Mirror screen" , i saw "Clone Screens" . Is that what you mean?
yes, it says mirror here, but that might be a change in jaunty
oh, i enabled it , now , they show the same thing!
err, what exactly happens when it's not enabled?
it does not detect the Screen, the Screen is black.
i mean, i did not use the independent screen ever, and now i want to use it to show more things. i mean show different things on the two screen,
pastebin the output of 'xrandr'
it should be as simple as clicking on both monitors and clicking Enable
pastebin your /var/log/Xorg.0.log
wc -l /etc/X11/xorg.conf
http://dpaste.com/4371/
that works too :)
just a guess, but maybe hardy doesn't fully support the 4500
try asking #intel-gfx about the error you got
I mean the "screen cannot be larger than 1280x1280" error, btw
